data.title: Rewarded by color
data.solution:
from datetime import date


def launch(s, f):
    d1, m1, y1 = [int(i) for i in s.split(".")]
    d2, m2, y2 = [int(i) for i in f.split(".")]
    d1 = date(y1, m1, d1)
    d2 = date(y2, m2, d2)
    diff = abs(d2-d1).days
    hours = diff * 5 * 1000
    if 0 <= hours <= 16777215:
        result = hex(hours)[2:].upper()
        if len(result) != 6:
            result = "0" * (6-len(result)) + result
    else:
        result = "fail"
    print(result)


s = input()
f = input()

launch(s, f)
data.statement:
There are {{1000}} people that work in some company. Each of them works fixed {{5}} hours per day including weekends.

<<Two dates>> are given in input: the day they <<started>> a project, and the day they <<finished>> it.

Based on how much hours were spent to finish this project (<<sum>> of hours for each worker in company <<in total>>), the company will get a badge of specific <<color>>, which in <<hexadecimal>> system equals to quantity of <<hours spent>> in <<decimal>> system.

You must output color of obtained badge in <<hexadecimal>> format (<<without "0x">> at the beginning).

<<Note 1:>> even if workers started or ended the project in the middle of the day etc., that day will be also counted as {{5}} hours.
<<Note 2:>> output color will always contain 6 characters, for example, {{0x3A8}} number should be represented as {{0003A8}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read s:string(16)
read f:string(16)
write fail
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[s]] that points the day when the project was started.
<<Line 2:>> A string [[f]] that points the day when the project was finished.
Both dates are given in {{DD.MM.YYYY}} format and are always valid values.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> A string containing one of two types of answer: either color in format {{FFFFFF}}, or word {{fail}} if it is not possible to detect this color.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There are 1000 people that work in some company. Each of them works fixed 5 hours per day including weekends.

Two dates are given in input: the day they started a project, and the day they finished it.

Based on how much hours were spent to finish this project (sum of hours for each worker in company in total), the company will get a badge of specific color, which in hexadecimal system equals to quantity of hours spent in decimal system.

You must output color of obtained badge in hexadecimal format (without "0x" at the beginning).

Note 1: even if workers started or ended the project in the middle of the day etc., that day will be also counted as 5 hours.
Note 2: output color will always contain 6 characters, for example, 0x3A8 number should be represented as 0003A8.
Input
Line 1: A string s that points the day when the project was started.
Line 2: A string f that points the day when the project was finished.
Both dates are given in DD.MM.YYYY format and are always valid values.
Output
Line 1 : A string containing one of two types of answer: either color in format FFFFFF, or word fail if it is not possible to detect this color.
Constraints
Example
Input
20.11.2012
26.04.2018
Output
974A78
